text:
* Accenture has signed a 3-year deal to be the lead shirt sponsor for MI New York, the defending champion of Major League Cricket and affiliate of the Mumbai Indians, a popular Indian cricket team.
* The deal was facilitated by Ben Sturner's Leverage Agency.

* Australian fast bowler Pat Cummins has signed a four-year deal with the San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC.
* The second season of MLC is set to start on July 5, soon after the T20 World Cup concludes.
* Cummins joins other Australian players Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and Steve Smith in the league, and will play alongside Jake Fraser-McGurk at the San Francisco Unicorns.
* The MLC has been awarded List A status by the ICC, putting it on par with other established T20 leagues like the IPL.
* The league currently has six teams, but plans to expand to 10 teams in the coming years.

* Accenture has partnered with MI New York, a team in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament, as its principal partner for three years.
* The MLC tournament is set to begin its second season this summer, starting July 5th.
* MI New York is a T20 cricket team that plays in the MLC and is part of the MI family, a leading global cricket brand with five T20 teams across three continents and four countries.
* MI New York is the inaugural and defending champion of the MLC, having won the title in 2023.
* The partnership with Accenture will focus on using data analytics, video analysis, and smart technologies to boost the performance of MI New York's coaches and players, as well as improve team operations and fan experiences.

* Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins has been signed by the San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming MLC season.
* Cummins joins compatriots Matt Short and Jake Fraser-McGurk at the franchise and will form a strong bowling attack with Pakistan's Haris Rauf and New Zealand's Matt Henry.
* Cummins expressed his excitement to join the Unicorns and play in the MLC, citing the rapid growth of cricket in the US.
* The San Francisco Unicorns co-owner Anand Rajaraman praised Cummins as one of the world's greatest players and welcomed him to the franchise.
* Cummins has committed to a long-term contract with the Unicorns, demonstrating his faith in the team's vision for growing cricket in the Bay Area and the US.

**Key Signings**: Australian captain Pat Cummins has signed a four-year contract with the San Francisco Unicorns, while all-rounder Marcus Stoinis is set to join the Texas Super Kings.

**MLC 2024 Details**: The second season of MLC will take place from July 6 to 29, 2024, across three cities in the USA - Dallas, New York, and Texas. The tournament has acquired List A status from the International Cricket Council.

**Teams and Players**: San Francisco Unicorns will feature Pat Cummins and Jake Fraser McGurk, while Texas Super Kings will have Marcus Stoinis, Aaron Hardie, Daryl Mitchell, Aiden Markram, and Naveen Ul Haq.

**Availability**: It is uncertain whether Cummins and Stoinis will be available for the entire tournament, as Australia is scheduled to tour the West Indies for a full series in June-July 2024.

* Texas has become the hub of cricket in America due to its favorable location, weather, and facilities.
* The Grand Prairie facility in Dallas, which will host four matches during the World Cup, has attracted many players from around the world, including international and domestic cricketers.
* The facility was built on the site of a former baseball stadium and has undergone $21 million in upgrades, funded by MLC investors and teams.
* The location was chosen due to its central location in the US, accessibility to the Dallas-Fort Worth airport, and favorable weather, allowing for cricket to be played for 10 months of the year.
* The large South Asian diaspora in Texas was also a key factor in choosing the location, with many cricket enthusiasts and players already based in the area.
* The growth of cricket in the area has been exponential, with new grounds and facilities popping up in nearby towns, and a strong junior cricket program in the area.
* While the sport is currently dominated by the South Asian diaspora, there is an opportunity to grow a wider fan base and attract new fans to the sport.

**Tournament Details:**

* The second season of MLC is scheduled to take place from July 6 to 29.
* The tournament has acquired List A status from the International Cricket Council (ICC).

**Player Signings:**

* Pat Cummins has signed a four-year contract with San Francisco Unicorns.
* Other Australian players who have signed with MLC teams include:
	+ Jake Fraser McGurk (San Francisco Unicorns)
	+ Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and Steve Smith (Washington Freedom)
* Other international players who have signed with MLC teams include:
	+ Rachin Ravindra (Washington Freedom)
	+ Shakib Al Hasan and David Miller (Los Angeles Knight Riders)
	+ Anrich Nortje and Romario Shepherd (MI New York)
	+ Aiden Markram and Daryl Mitchell (Texas Super Kings)
	+ Nandre Burger and Obed McCoy (Seattle Orcas)

* The second season of the USA's Major League Cricket (MLC) is scheduled to take place from July 6 to 29.
* The tournament has acquired List A status from the International Cricket Council (ICC).
* Australian pacer Pat Cummins has signed a four-year contract with San Francisco Unicorns, becoming the latest Australian to join the MLC.
* Other notable players who have signed up for the MLC include Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Steve Smith, Shakib Al Hasan, David Miller, Anrich Nortje, Romario Shepherd, Aiden Markram, Daryl Mitchell, Nandre Burger, and Obed McCoy.
* The MLC has attracted players from around the world, with teams including San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, Texas Super Kings, and Seattle Orcas.

**Summary:**

* 45 players from Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) will participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024, which will take place in the USA and the West Indies from June 1 to 29, 2024.
* MLC, America's first world-class domestic tournament, was recently awarded List-A status by the ICC, recognizing it as an official T20 league.
* The league features six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom, comprising international and domestic talent.
* The 45 MLC players participating in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup represent various countries, including the USA, West Indies, Australia, Bangladesh, Afghanistan, South Africa, Ireland, New Zealand, and Pakistan.
* MLC has made a significant impact on the cricket landscape in the USA, with its inaugural 2023 season being a huge success, and is now gearing up for its second season, which starts on July 5.

**Tournament Details**

* The second season of MLC is set to kick off on July 5, just a week after the ICC T20 World Cup 2024.
* The tournament features six franchises, each with a mix of retained international players and new signings.

**Retained International Players**

* MI New York: Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Dewald Brevis, Kagiso Rabada, Tim David, Rashid Khan, and Trent Boult
* Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen, Wayne Parnell, and Imad Wasim
* Texas Super Kings: Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, and Mitchell Santner
* San Francisco Unicorns: Finn Allen and Haris Rauf
* Washington Freedom: Akeal Hosein and Marco Jansen
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Adam Zampa, Spencer Johnson, and Jason Roy

**New International Signings**

* Notable new signings include Australian superstars Pat Cummins, Glenn Maxwell, and Marcus Stoinis
* Other new signings include Anrich Nortje, Nandre Burger, Obed McCoy, Lance Morris, Aiden Markram, Aaron Hardie, Daryl Mitchell, Naveen ul Haq, Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Sherfane Rutherford, Jack Edwards, Rachin Ravindra, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Shakib Al Hasan, David Miller, Adithya Ganesh, Josh Little, and Waqar Salamkheil.

The article promises a thrilling season filled with world-class cricket, featuring a mix of established stars and newcomers.

The Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament has signed Australian Test captain Pat Cummins to a four-year deal to play with the San Francisco Unicorns, enhancing the strength of MLC as a T20 destination. Cummins is one of several high-profile Australians to join the competition, including Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell. The MLC is set to take place from July 6 to 29 this year, and has gained List A status for its second season, making it an official T20 league with records counting towards official T20 statistics. The tournament has attracted top players, including batting dynamo Jake Fraser-McGurk, Travis Head, and Smith, who will play for Washington Freedom. The MLC's growth and development are seen as a significant opportunity for cricket in the US, with Cummins citing the "huge" market potential and long-term possibilities beyond cricket.

**Key Points:**

* Pat Cummins, the Australian captain, has been signed by the San Francisco Unicorns franchise for the second season of the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament.
* Cummins is expected to lead the Unicorns in the MLC 2024 season, which starts on July 6 (IST).
* The Unicorns finished 5th in the 6-franchise tournament in the previous season, winning 2 out of 5 league games under Aaron Finch's captaincy.
* The current roster of the Unicorns includes star players such as Corey Anderson, Haris Rauf, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Josh Inglis, with Cummins' signing further strengthening their squad.
* The MLC 2024 season is scheduled to start on July 6, with a relatively free window for international players as the T20 World Cup will conclude a week prior to MLC's start.

**Key Signing:** Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins has joined the San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming MLC season.

**International Signings:** The six MLC teams have made several international signings, including:

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Shakib Al Hasan, David Miller, Adithya Ganesh, Josh Little, and Waqar Salamkheil
* MI New York: Romario Shepherd and Anrich Nortje
* San Francisco Unicorns: Pat Cummins, Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Sherfane Rutherford
* Seattle Orcas: Nandre Burger, Obed McCoy, Nathan Ellis, and Lance Morris
* Texas Super Kings: Aiden Markram, Aaron Hardie, Daryl Mitchell, and Naveen ul Haq
* Washington Freedom: Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Jack Edwards, and Rachin Ravindra

**Upcoming Season:** The second season of the MLC is approaching, with tickets selling fast. Fans are encouraged to secure their tickets early to avoid missing out on the action.

* Australian cricketer Pat Cummins has signed a four-year deal with the San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC.
* The second season of MLC is set to start on July 5, just after the T20 World Cup.
* Cummins will join fellow Australian Jake Fraser-McGurk at the Unicorns and other Australian players Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and Steve Smith in the league.
* Cummins cited the rapid development of MLC and the huge market potential for cricket in the US as reasons for his involvement.
* The San Francisco Unicorns are co-owned by Silicon Valley entrepreneurs Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan.
* MLC was recently awarded List A status by the International Cricket Council, making it an official T20 league on par with the Indian Premier League.
* The league plans to expand from six teams to 10 in the coming years.

**Key Player Signing:** Pat Cummins, the Australian men's captain, has signed a four-year deal to play for the San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket (MLC) from 2024 onwards.

**Team Update:** Cummins will join the Unicorns' bowling attack, which already features Haris Rauf of Pakistan and Matt Henry of New Zealand.

**2024 MLC Season:** The 2024 MLC season is set to begin on July 5, with the Unicorns' first match scheduled for July 7 against the LA Knight Riders.

**League Expansion:** MLC plans to expand the league, with aims to increase the number of games from 19 to 34 by the 2025 season. The league is also expected to introduce two new franchises in the future.

**Availability:** Cummins is expected to be available for the entire league as the 2024 season does not clash with any of Australia's forthcoming international commitments.
